content.verses:
[
    [0] {
      order: 1
      type: verse
      hawaiian_text: 
      | ‘O ka ‘ilima nō koʻu lei
      | Ka liʻa ia nei puʻu wai
      | He wehi ia no kuʻu kino
      | Lei hoʻohihi a ka mana‘o
      | ‘I‘ini au lā i kou nani
      | He hiwahiwa i ka‘u ‘ike
      | ‘O wau kou hoa e kohu ai
      | E lei ‘ilima ē. lei ‘ilima
      english_text: 
      | The ‘ilima is my lei and
      | The joy of my heart
      | The adornment for me
      | It is dear to my thoughts
      | I greatly desire its beauty
      | A charming lei to my sight
      | It is the companion suitable to your beauty
      | The ‘ilima wreath, the ʻilima wreath
      hawaiian_lines: [‘O ka ‘ilima nō koʻu lei, Ka liʻa ia nei puʻu wai, He wehi ia no kuʻu kino, Lei hoʻohihi a ka mana‘o, ‘I‘ini au lā i kou nani, He hiwahiwa i ka‘u ‘ike, ‘O wau kou hoa e kohu ai, E lei ‘ilima ē. lei ‘ilima]
      english_lines: [The ‘ilima is my lei and, The joy of my heart, The adornment for me, It is dear to my thoughts, I greatly desire its beauty, A charming lei to my sight, It is the companion suitable to your beauty, The ‘ilima wreath, the ʻilima wreath]
    }
  ]

metadata.source_publication: King's Book of Hawaiian Melodies © 1926,43 Charles E. King - Translated by Mary Pukui
